episode_summary: This episode features guest Sally Phillips alongside Dan Schreiber, Andrew Hunter Murray, and James Harkin, covering Greenland’s quirky New Year countdown, Merriam-Webster’s backwards-word index, how airlines historically disguised deceased passengers mid-flight, and how Australians respond to accent and slang usage. The chat spirals into maps, dictionaries, aviation incidents, flight simulation, and Australian slang and accents.

facts.fact: Greenlanders start their new year countdown, 14,410 seconds before midnight.
Okay, my fact this week is that Miriam Webster has a collection of cards of all words in the English language spelled backwards.
My fact this week is that if you ever saw a passenger on British airways sitting with a vodka tonic and wearing sunglasses, they were most likely dead.
And it just found that using Australian slang is a pro, but only in an Aussie accent. So people, Australians like people who speak with an Australian accent.
